title: Nursing Pay and Shortages During Covid-19
sub_head: Higher pay will motivate more people to become nurses, work longer hours or defer retirement.
body:
The clamor and drama surrounding travel nurses’ pay is indicative of a larger issue: the unsustainable design of our healthcare system and the undue strain it places on healthcare workers (“Steep Nurse Pay Raises Irk Hospitals,” U.S. News, Feb. 9).
As a nurse in this pandemic, I am disheartened see my travel-nurse colleagues make significantly more than I do. But more disheartening is seeing hospitals and lawmakers focus only on capping travel-nurse pay instead of seeking a way to bolster the strength of the nurse workforce as a whole.
